Key Match Events: Jameson Taillon pitched six strong innings to help the Cubs beat the Yankees 2-1.
Isaac Paredes hit a two-RBI single during the first inning.
Cubs pitchers held the Yankees to six runs and kept key hitters like Juan Soto, Aaron Judge, Giancarlo Stanton, and Jazz Chisholm Jr. from hitting home runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Jameson Taillon expressed pride in beating his friend and former teammate Gerrit Cole.
Isaac Paredes hoped his hit would serve as motivation for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Former pitcher Kerry Wood and former third baseman Aramis Ramírez were inducted into the Cubs Hall of Fame before the game.
